009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D50;
012
013import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
014
015import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
016import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
017import imagingbook.common.color.cie.CieUtils;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019//import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
020
021/**
022 * A color space specified by its RGB primaries and white point coordinates, all defined
023 * in two-dimensional CIE xy-space. The associated 3D XYZ coordinates are calculated from
024 * the 2D coordinates. This guarantees that all associated XYZ coordinates are consistent.
025 * Note that there is a substantial variation in published XYZ data. This setup relies
026 * on xy color coordinates only, and consistent XYZ coordinates are obtained by solving
027 * a system of linear equations to recover the unknown Yr, Yg, and Yb coordinates.
028 *
029 */
030@SuppressWarnings("serial")
031public abstract class AbstractRgbColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
032
033        private static final ColorSpace CS_sRGB = ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_sRGB);
034
035    private final double[] XYZw;      // XYZ coordinates of white point
036    protected final double[][] Mrgb, Mrgbi;
037    protected final ChromaticAdaptation catWtoD50; // = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
038    protected final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toW; // = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
039
040    /**
041     * Constructor, builds a color space from CIE xy-coordinates of tristimulus values and white point.
042     * @param xr x-coordinate of primary R
043     * @param yr y-coordinate of primary R
044     * @param xg x-coordinate of primary G
045     * @param yg y-coordinate of primary G
046     * @param xb x-coordinate of primary B
047     * @param yb y-coordinate of primary B
048     * @param xw x-coordinate of white point
049     * @param yw y-coordinate of white point
050     */
051    public AbstractRgbColorSpace(double xr, double yr, double xg, double yg, double xb, double yb, double xw, double yw) {
052        super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
053        this.XYZw = CieUtils.xyYToXYZ(xw, yw, 1);
054
055        this.catWtoD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(XYZw, D50.getXYZ());
056        this.catD50toW = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50.getXYZ(), XYZw);
057
058        double[][] M =
059               {{xr / yr, xg / yg, xb / yb},
060                {1, 1, 1},
061                {(1 - xr - yr) / yr, (1 - xg - yg) / yg, (1 - xb - yb) / yb }};
062        double[] YYY = Matrix.solve(M, XYZw);   // determine {Yr, Yg, Yb}
063
064        // RGB primaries in XYZ
065        double[] XYZr = CieUtils.xyYToXYZ(xr, yr, YYY[0]);
066        double[] XYZg = CieUtils.xyYToXYZ(xg, yg, YYY[1]);
067        double[] XYZb = CieUtils.xyYToXYZ(xb, yb, YYY[2]);
068
069        this.Mrgbi = Matrix.transpose(new double[][] {XYZr, XYZg, XYZb});
070        this.Mrgb  = Matrix.inverse(Mrgbi);
071    }
072
073    /**
074         * Returns the XYZ coordinates of the white point associated with this color space (typically D65 or D50).
075         *
076         * @return the white point
077         */
078    public float[] getWhitePoint() {
079        return Matrix.toFloat(XYZw);
080    }
081
082    /**
083         * Returns the XYZ color coordinates for the primary color with the specified index, measured relative to the white
084         * point of this color space (see {@link #getWhitePoint()}).
085         *
086         * @param idx the color index (R = 0, G = 1, B = 2)
087         * @return the XYZ coordinate for the primary color
088         */
089    public float[] getPrimary(int idx) {
090        return Matrix.toFloat(Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx));
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Returns the 3x3 matrix for converting from CIE-XYZ color space to linear RGB.
095     * Its column vectors are the XYZ coordinates of the RGB primaries.
096     * @return a 3x3 matrix
097     * @see #getMrgb()
098     */
099    public double[][] getMrgbi() {
100        return this.Mrgbi;
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Returns the 3x3 matrix for converting from linear RGB to CIE-XYZ color space.
105     * @return a 3x3 matrix
106     * @see #getMrgbi()
107     */
108    public double[][] getMrgb() {
109        return this.Mrgb;
110    }
111
112    // -----------------------------------------------------------
113
114    @Override   // convert from sRGB to a color in this space (via XYZ50)
115    public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
116        float[] xyz50 = CS_sRGB.fromRGB(srgb);
117        return this.fromCIEXYZ(xyz50);
118    }
119
120    @Override   // convert from a color in this space to sRGB (via XYZ50)
121    public float[] toRGB(float[] rgbTHIS) {
122        float[] xyz50 = this.toCIEXYZ(rgbTHIS);
123        return CS_sRGB.toRGB(xyz50);
124    }
125
126    // --------------------------------------------------------
127
128    private static final String[] ComponentNames = {"R", "G", "B"};
129
130    @Override
131    public String getName (int idx) {
132        return ComponentNames[idx];
133    }
134
135    // --------------------------------------------------

173}
